settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy actions sensor, wh: Home Assistant legacy actions sensor, when enabled a action sensor will be discoverd and an empty `action` will be send after every published action.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant experimental event entiti: Home Assistant experimental event entities, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add event entities for exposed actions. The events and attributes are currently deemed experimental and subject to change.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an active device will b: Time after which an active device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Maximum jitter (in msec) allowed on time: Maximum jitter (in msec) allowed on timeout to avoid availability pings trying to trigger around the same time
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Enable timeout backoff on failed availab: Enable timeout backoff on failed availability pings (x1.5, x3, x6, x12...)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Pause availability pings when backoff re: Pause availability pings when backoff reaches over this limit until a new Zigbee message is received from the device. A value of zero disables pausing.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Options for passive devices (mostly batt: Options for passive devices (mostly battery powered)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an passive device will: Time after which an passive device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT mes: MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TL: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Include device information to mqtt messa: Include device information to mqtt messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable retain for all send messages. ON: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if your MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Specifies the maximum allowed packet len: Specifies the maximum allowed packet length (in bytes) that the server can send to Zigbee2MQTT. NOTE: The same value exists in your MQTT broker but for the length the client can send to it instead.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of the adapter. To autodetect t: Location of the adapter. To autodetect the port, set null
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable LED of the adapter if supported: Disable LED of the adapter if supported
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter type, not needed unless you are: Adapter type, not needed unless you are experiencing problems
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Baud rate speed for serial port, this ca: Baud rate speed for serial port, this can be anything firmware support but default is 115200 for Z-Stack and EZSP, 38400 for Deconz, however note that some EZSP firmware need 57600
settingsSchemaDescriptions.RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for seri: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serial port
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Block devices from the network (by ieeeA: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Allow only certain devices to join the n: Allow only certain devices to join the network (by ieeeAddr). Note that all devices not on the passlist will be removed from the network!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Your device may request a check for a ne: Your device may request a check for a new firmware update. This value determines how frequently third party servers may actually be contacted to look for firmware updates. The value is set in minutes, and the default is 1 day.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee devices may request a firmware up: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of override OTA index file: Location of override OTA index file
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Limits the rate of requests (in millisec: Limits the rate of requests (in milliseconds) during OTA updates to reduce network congestion. You can increase this value if your network appears unstable during OTA.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The size of file chunks sent during an u: The size of file chunks sent during an update (in bytes). Note: This value may get ignored for manufacturers that require specific values.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Frontend binding port. Ignored when usin: Frontend binding port. Ignored when using a unix domain socket
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix s: Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix socket when an absolute path is given instead.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.URL on which the frontend can be reached: URL on which the frontend can be reached, currently only used for the Home Assistant device configuration page
settingsSchemaDescriptions.SSL Certificate file path for exposing H: SSL Certificate file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_key' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. Th: SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_cert' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Base URL for the frontend. If hosted und: Base URL for the frontend. If hosted under a subpath, e.g. 'http://localhost:8080/z2m', set this to '/z2m'
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Hide frontend notifications matching spe: Hide frontend notifications matching specified regex strings. Example: 'z2m: Failed to ping.*'
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Create symlink to current logs in the lo: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Output location of the log, leave empty: Output location of the log, leave empty to suppress logging
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Log file name, can also contain timestam: Log file name, can also contain timestamp
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Set individual log levels for certain na: Set individual log levels for certain namespaces
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Log debug level to MQTT and frontend (ma: Log debug level to MQTT and frontend (may decrease overall performance)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Do not log these namespaces (regex-based: Do not log these namespaces (regex-based) for debug level
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Number of log directories to keep before: Number of log directories to keep before deleting the oldest one
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The host running syslogd, defaults to lo: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The port on the host that syslog is runn: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The network protocol to log over (e.g. t: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.PID of the process that log messages are: PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Host to indicate that log messages are c: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The type of the syslog protocol to use (: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The name of the application (Default: Zi: The name of the application (Default: Zigbee2MQTT).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The end of line character to be added to: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ZigBee pan ID, changing requires re-pair: ZigBee pan ID, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee extended pan ID, changing require: Zigbee extended pan ID, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee channel, changing might require r: Zigbee channel, changing might require re-pairing some devices! (Note: use a ZLL channel: 11, 15, 20, or 25 to avoid problems)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 o: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT message payload will contain all at: MQTT message payload will contain all attributes, not only changed ones. Has to be true when integrating via Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Persist cached state, only used when cac: Persist cached state, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Send cached state on startup, only used: Send cached state on startup, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messag: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT message: Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT messages, contains milliseconds since the previous msg
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Network encryption key, changing require: Network encryption key, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Transmit power of adapter, only availabl: Transmit power of adapter, only available for Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) adapters, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 max is = 20dbm (5dbm default)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Examples when 'state' of a device is pub: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By d: Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By default this is the device ID
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Retain MQTT messages of this device: Retain MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disables the device (excludes device fro: Disables the device (excludes device from network scans, availability and group state updates)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds,: Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds, Make sure to set mqtt.version to 5
settingsSchemaDescriptions.QoS level for MQTT messages of this devi: QoS level for MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The minimum time between payloads in sec: The minimum time between payloads in seconds. Payloads received whilst the device is being throttled will be discarded
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Protects unique payload values of specif: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from publis: Filter attributes with regex from published payload.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from being: Filter attributes with regex from being added to the cache, this prevents the attribute from being in the published payload when the value didn't change.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from optimi: Filter attributes with regex from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The user-defined device icon for the fro: The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a full URL link to an image (e.g. https://SOME.SITE/MODEL123.jpg) or a path to a local file inside the `device_icons` directory (e.g. device_icons/MODEL123.png).

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Control when to publish state OFF or CLO: Control when to publish state OFF or CLOSE for a group. 'all_members_off': only publish state OFF/CLOSE when all group members are in state OFF/CLOSE,  'last_member_state': publish state OFF whenever one of its members changes to OFF

It will run for 30 seconds per time with the screen displaying "Ad", then return to its normal working state again.

featureDescriptions.The temperature sensor of the TRV is — d: The temperature sensor of the TRV is — due to its design — relatively close to the heat source (i.e. the hot water in the radiator). Thus there are situations where the `local_temperature` measured by the TRV is not accurate enough: If the radiator is covered behind curtains or furniture, if the room is rather big, or if the radiator itself is big and the flow temperature is high, then the temperature in the room may easily diverge from the `local_temperature` measured by the TRV by 5°C to 8°C. In this case you might choose to use an external room sensor and send the measured value of the external room sensor to the `External_measured_room_sensor` property. The way the TRV operates on the `External_measured_room_sensor` depends on the setting of the `Radiator_covered` property: If `Radiator_covered` is `false` (Auto Offset Mode): You *must* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at least* every 3 hours. After 3 hours the TRV disables this function and resets the value of the `External_measured_room_sensor` property to -8000 (disabled). You *should* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at most* every 30 minutes or every 0.1°C change in measured room temperature. If `Radiator_covered` is `true` (Room Sensor Mode): You *must* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at least* every 30 minutes. After 35 minutes the TRV disables this function and resets the value of the `External_measured_room_sensor` property to -8000 (disabled). You *should* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at most* every 5 minutes or every 0.1°C change in measured room temperature. The unit of this value is 0.01 `°C` (so e.g. 21°C would be represented as 2100).
featureDescriptions.Controls whether the TRV should solely r: Controls whether the TRV should solely rely on an external room sensor or operate in offset mode. `false` = Auto Offset Mode (use this e.g. for exposed radiators) or `true` = Room Sensor Mode (use this e.g. for covered radiators). Please note that this flag only controls how the TRV operates on the value of `External_measured_room_sensor`; only setting this flag without setting the `External_measured_room_sensor` has no (noticeable?) effect.

featureDescriptions.MANUAL MODE ☝ - In this mode, the device: MANUAL MODE ☝ - In this mode, the device executes manual temperature setting. When the set temperature is lower than the "minimum temperature", the valve is closed (forced closed). PROGRAMMING MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the device executes a preset week programming temperature time and temperature. HOLIDAY MODE ⛱ - In this mode, for example, the vacation mode is set for 10 days and the temperature is setto 15 degrees Celsius. After 10 days, the device will automatically switch to programming mode. TEMPORARY MANUAL MODE - In this mode, ☝ icon will flash. At this time, the device executes the manually set temperature and returns to the weekly programming mode in the next time period.
featureDescriptions.PROGRAMMING MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the d: PROGRAMMING MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the device executes a preset week programming temperature time and temperature. You can set up to 4 stages of temperature every for WEEKDAY ➀➁➂➃➄,  SATURDAY ➅ and SUNDAY ➆.

featureDescriptions.Definition of a new region to be added (: Definition of a new region to be added (or replace existing one). Creating or modifying a region requires you to define which zones of a 7x4 detection grid should be active for that zone. Regions can overlap, meaning that a zone can be defined in more than one region (eg. "zone x = 1 & y = 1" can be added to region 1 & 2). "Zone x = 1 & y = 1" is the nearest zone on the right (from sensor's perspective, along the detection path).

featureDescriptions.The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manu: The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manually. During a gas alarm, the buzzer can be manually muted for 10 minutes ("mute"), but cannot be unmuted manually before this timeout expires. The buzzer cannot be pre-muted, as this function only works during a gas alarm. During the absence of a gas alarm, the buzzer can be manually alarmed ("alarm") and disalarmed ("mute"), but for this "linkage_alarm" option must be enabled
featureDescriptions.When this option is enabled and a gas al: When this option is enabled and a gas alarm has occurred, then "linkage_alarm_state"=true, and when the gas alarm has ended or the buzzer has been manually muted, then "linkage_alarm_state"=false

featureDescriptions.The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manu: The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manually. During the absence of a smoke alarm, the buzzer can be manually alarmed ("alarm") and disalarmed ("mute"), but for this "linkage_alarm" option must be enabled

featureDescriptions.When this option is enabled and a smoke: When this option is enabled and a smoke alarm has occurred, then "linkage_alarm_state"=true, and when the smoke alarm has ended or the buzzer has been manually muted, then "linkage_alarm_state"=false

featureDescriptions.Valve open position (percentage) control: Valve open position (percentage) control. If the opening degree is set to 100%, the valve is fully open when it is opened. If the opening degree is set to 0%, the valve is fully closed when it is opened, and the default value is 100%. Note: only version v1.1.4 or higher is supported.
featureDescriptions.Valve closed position (percentage) contr: Valve closed position (percentage) control. If the closing degree is set to 100%, the valve is fully closed when it is closed. If the closing degree is set to 0%, the valve is fully opened when it is closed, and the default value is 100%. Note: Only version v1.1.4 or higher is supported.
featureDescriptions.Temperature control accuracy. The range: Temperature control accuracy. The range is -0.2 ~ -1°C, with an interval of 0.2, and the default is -1. If the temperature control accuracy is selected as -1°C (default value) and the target temperature is 26 degrees, then TRVZB will close the valve when the room temperature reaches 26 degrees and open the valve at 25 degrees. If -0.4°C is chosen as the temperature control accuracy, then the valve will close when the room temperature reaches 26 degrees and open at 25.6 degrees.Note: Only version v1.3.0 or higher is supported.
featureDescriptions.The preset heating schedule to use when: The preset heating schedule to use when the system mode is set to "auto" (indicated with ⏲ on the TRV). Up to 6 transitions can be defined per day, where a transition is expressed in the format 'HH:mm/temperature', each separated by a space. The first transition for each day must start at 00:00 and the valid temperature range is 4-35°C (in 0.5°C steps). The temperature will be set at the time of the first transition until the time of the next transition, e.g. '04:00/20 10:00/25' will result in the temperature being set to 20°C at 04:00 until 10:00, when it will change to 25°C.

featureDescriptions.The holiday mode will automatically star: The holiday mode will automatically start at the set time starting point and run the holiday temperature. Can be defined in the following format: `startYear/startMonth/startDay startHours:startMinutes | endYear/endMonth/endDay endHours:endMinutes`. For example: `2022/10/01 16:30 | 2022/10/21 18:10`. After the end of holiday mode, it switches to "auto" mode and uses schedule.
featureDescriptions.`mon_sun` - schedule for Monday used for: `mon_sun` - schedule for Monday used for each day (define it only for Monday). `mon_fri+sat+sun` - schedule for workdays used from Monday (define it only for Monday), Saturday and Sunday are defined separately. `separate` - schedule for each day is defined separately.
Schedule will work with "auto" preset. In this mode, the device executes a preset week programming temperature time and temperature. Before using these properties, check `working_day` property. Each day can contain up to 10 segments. At least 1 segment should be defined. Different count of segments can be defined for each day, e.g., 3 segments for Monday, 5 segments for Thursday, etc. It should be defined in the following format: `hours:minutes/temperature`. Minutes can be only tens, i.e., 00, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. Segments should be divided by space symbol. Each day should end with the last segment of 24:00. Examples: `04:00/20 08:30/22 10:10/18 18:40/24 22:50/19.5`; `06:00/21.5 17:20/26 24:00/18`. The temperature will be set from the beginning/start of one period and until the next period, e.g., `04:00/20 24:00/22` means that from 00:00 to 04:00 temperature will be 20 degrees and from 04:00 to 00:00 temperature will be 22 degrees.

AUTO MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the device executes a preset week programming temperature time and temperature. ON - In this mode, the thermostat stays open OFF - In this mode, the thermostat stays closed

featureDescriptions.Setting minimum 0 - maximum 90 minutes b: Setting minimum 0 - maximum 90 minutes boost time. The boost function is activated. The remaining time for the function will be counted down in minutes ( 90 to 0 ).

featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected pr: Indicates whether the device detected presence. Will be true also when movement (occupancy) is detected.
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected mo: Indicates whether the device detected movement. Will be true when movement. Can remain true even if the target left the detection range. In this case presence will be reset to false reliably.

featureDescriptions.The radar sensor can be set in three sta: The radar sensor can be set in three states: on, occupied and unoccupied. For example, if set to occupied, it will continue to maintain presence regardless of whether someone is present or not. If set to unoccupied, the unoccupied state will be maintained permanently.
featureDescriptions.In debug mode, radar will report more in: In debug mode, radar will report more information, can be used to identify interference
featureDescriptions.Duration of the window opening mode: Duration of the window opening mode
featureDescriptions.The remaining time for the function will: The remaining time for the function will be counted down in seconds ( 900 to 0 ) when the boost heating is activated.
featureDescriptions.How much power is the heater rated to. E: How much power is the heater rated to. Entering a value will allow the Thermostat to record a value of power usage that can be checked under settings on the physical Thermostat
featureDescriptions.Choose the number of mode your heater su: Choose the number of mode your heater supports.
featureDescriptions.Schedule for the auto mode. Can be defin: Schedule for the auto mode. Can be defined in the following format: `mode / hours:minutes / mode`. For example: `comfort / 06:00 / eco / 12:00 / off`. Note: Minutes can only be set by multiple of 5. Your limited to 9 modes max.
featureDescriptions.The holiday mode will automatically star: The holiday mode will automatically start at the set time starting point and run the holiday mode. Can be defined in the following format: `startYear/startMonth/startDay startHours:startMinutes | endYear/endMonth/endDay endHours:endMinutes  | mode`. For example: `2024/12/12 09:00 | 2024/12/14 10:00 | comfort`Note: You cannot set an interval superior at 255 hours. The end date minutes will be ignore.
featureDescriptions.Startup: when room temperature decreases: Startup: when room temperature decreases by 3°C within 5 minutes, stop heating. Close: when room temperature rises by 3 degrees / 48 minutes later / manual (three ways). After the window opening mode is turned on, one of these three conditions can trigger to exit the window opening mode.
featureDescriptions.The difference required between local te: The difference required between local temperature and set point to trigger the valve.
featureDescriptions.The larger the value, the more sensitive: The larger the value, the more sensitive it is (refresh and update only while active)
featureDescriptions.Light sensing sampling(refresh and updat: Light sensing sampling(refresh and update only while active)
featureDescriptions.Presence state: none, motion, or station: Presence state: none, motion, or stationary
featureDescriptions.Keep the temperature in a range: Keep the temperature in a range
featureDescriptions.Specifies the amount of time, in units o: Specifies the amount of time, in units of 0.1 seconds, which will be used during a transition to either the on or off state, when an on/off/toggle command of the on/off cluster is used to turn the light on or off
featureDescriptions.Defines if you can send a brightness cha: Defines if you can send a brightness change without to turn on the light
featureDescriptions.Specifies the initial level to be applie: Specifies the initial level to be applied after the device is supplied with power
featureDescriptions.Specifies the minimum level that shall b: Specifies the minimum level that shall be applied, when an on/toggle command causes the light to turn on. When this attribute is set to the invalid value (255) this feature is disabled and standard rules apply: The light will either return to the previously active level (before it was turned off) if the OnLevel attribute is set to the invalid value (255/previous); or to the specified value of the OnLevel attribute if this value is in the range 0…254. Otherwise, if the MinimumOnLevel is in the range 0…254, the light will be set to the the previously active level (before it was turned off), or the value specified here, whichever is the larger value. For example, if the previous level was 30 and the MinimumOnLevel was 40 then the light would turn on and move to level 40. Conversely, if the previous level was 50, and the MinimumOnLevel was 40, then the light would turn on and move to level 50.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer supports AC forward phase con: The dimmer supports AC forward phase control.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer supports AC reverse phase con: The dimmer supports AC reverse phase control.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is capable of measuring the r: The dimmer is capable of measuring the reactanceto distinguish inductive and capacitive loads.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is capable of replacing the b: The dimmer is capable of replacing the built-in, default dimming curve.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is capable of detecting an ou: The dimmer is capable of detecting an output overload and shutting the output off.

featureDescriptions.The output is currently turned off, beca: The output is currently turned off, because the dimmer has detected an overload.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer's reactance discriminator had: The dimmer's reactance discriminator had detected a capacitive load.

featureDescriptions.Specifies the default heating setpoint d: Specifies the default heating setpoint during occupancy, representing the targeted temperature when a recurring weekly schedule ends without a follow-up schedule.
featureDescriptions.Specifies the duration period in seconds: Specifies the duration period in seconds, during which a remotely measured temperature value remains valid since its reception as attribute report.
featureDescriptions.Specifies whether the Open Window Detect: Specifies whether the Open Window Detection is activated or deactivated.
featureDescriptions.Specifies the maximum time duration in s: Specifies the maximum time duration in seconds for a detected open-window state. This attribute effectively defines how long a detected open-window state should last before H1 returns back to its default set point settings.
featureDescriptions.Specifies the time duration in minutes,: Specifies the time duration in minutes, within which the sharp temperature change must have taken place for the open window detection.
featureDescriptions.Specifies the temperature change thresho: Specifies the temperature change threshold for the Open Window Detection. This is the point at which the H1 detects a significant temperature change indicating the detection of an open or closed window.
featureDescriptions.Detected by sudden temperature drop or s: Detected by sudden temperature drop or set manually.
featureDescriptions.Manually set window_open, ~1 minute to t: Manually set window_open, ~1 minute to take affect.
featureDescriptions.Time in seconds after which noise is cle: Time in seconds after which noise is cleared after detecting it (default: 60)
featureDescriptions.Time in seconds after which occupancy is: Time in seconds after which occupancy is cleared after detecting it (default: 60)

featureDescriptions.If the sensor is triggered by the slight: If the sensor is triggered by the slightest movement, reduce the sensitivity, otherwise increase it (default: 50)

Automatic calibration of the CO2 sensor. If ON, the CO2 sensor will automatically calibrate every 7 days. (MH-Z19B sensor)
